title: 50 Best Spring Dessert Recipes - Easy Spring Dessert Ideas
description: Let's just say we've sprung forward... right into these desserts.
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchLemon Blueberry DessertsSpring SaladsCopycat Recipe IdeasBrunch RecipesSpring DinnersMeals & CookingRecipe Headquarters50 Spring Desserts To Celebrate The Season50 Spring Desserts To Celebrate The SeasonLet's just say we've sprung forward... right into these desserts. By Mackenzie Filson and Mo GoldsteinUpdated: Mar 21, 2025Save ArticlePHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREWarm summer days are on the horizon, what better way to celebrate this spring than by making pies, cakes, and cookies with the best and brightest fruits of the season? Let's just say, your farmers' market basket will be overflowing once you check out all our top strawberry, lemon, and rhubarb desserts. Don't worry if you're Team Chocolate, we've got more than a few ideas for you too amongst these 50 easy spring dessert recipes too.Spring is the easiest and breeziest season of them all, so we wanted to make sure we had desserts that were just as simple to whip up. And with big holidays like Easter, Passover, and Memorial Day on the calendar, it's always good to have a few impressive (yet beginner-friendly) desserts in your back pocket for when you really want to dazzle your guests. Our Aperol spritz trifle, our raspberry tiramisu, and our strawberry upside-down cake are some of our top showstoppers and endlessly adaptable for whatever you have on hand too.As the temps rise, we start wanting to use our oven less and less. Is that also you? Well, what better time to cool down than with no-bake desserts or an ice cream cake. Honestly, hot weather or not, do you really need a reason make our recipes for no- churn strawberry shortcake vegan ice cream and copycat Dairy Queen ice cream cake? We thought so.Still got Spring Fever? Check out all of our favorite spring weeknight dinner recipes, spring cocktail ideas, and top spring salads. 1Strawberry BrowniesPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: SAM SENEVIRATNEChannel your inner Glinda the Good Witch because these spellbinding strawberry brownies are pretty in pink, unapologetically charming, and ready to steal the spotlight at any spring celebration. Made from scratch with fresh strawberries and decorated with white chocolate-strawberry ganache, these beauties might sound complicated, but trust us‚Äîthey‚Äôre simple!Get the Strawberry Brownies recipe. 2Best Rhubarb PiePHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThough we love strawberry rhubarb pie (and our recipe is perfect), this pie lets the tart rhubarb take the center stage. Making homemade pie crust isn't totally necessary, but we highly recommend it. Don't have sanding sugar? No problem‚Äîjust sprinkle granulated sugar on top before baking.Get the Best-Ever Rhubarb Pie recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Grapefruit Meringue TartPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GORECitrus season should be heavily celebrated, and this grapefruit tart is reason enough. A simple curd is made using fresh grapefruit juice that is a perfect balance of tart and sweet. It‚Äôs a really beautiful tart that would shine at any spring brunch, or served at your next dinner party. Get the Grapefruit Meringue Tart recipe. 4Carrot Cake BlondiesPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSThis recipe takes the best of spiced carrot cake and chewy blondies and turns it into a delicious dessert bar that's great for sharing. Best part about them? You can make them ahead of time and frost when needed (perfect for bake sales!).Get the Carrot Cake Blondies recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5Lemon BarsPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREIf you prefer your desserts almost more tart than sweet, then these lemon bars are the perfect spring dessert for you. An ideal make-ahead dessert, these bars will be the star of all your spring & summer celebrations. Pucker up, buttercup!Get the Lemon Bars recipe.6Red Velvet Ice CreamPHOTO: KATE JORDAN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONThis creamy homemade red velvet ice cream is made with a buttermilk base and cocoa powder for that iconic chocolatey, tangy red velvet flavor. A cream cheese frosting is crucial to red velvet, so we added a swirl of the frosting throughout and crumbled some red velvet cake in too so you get bits in every bite. üòçGet the Red Velvet Ice Cream recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Costco Lemon-Blueberry Pound CakePHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThe reviews are in: Costco shoppers are OBSESSED with their new bakery offering, the Lemon-Blueberry Loaf Cake, and here at Delish, we agree that it‚Äôs practically perfect‚Ä¶ so perfect that we had to develop a copycat version of it. Get the Costco Lemon-Blueberry Pound Cake recipe. 8Aperol Spritz TriflesPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONThis trifle draws inspiration from everybody‚Äôs favorite summer cocktail: the Aperol Spritz. This popular beverage fuses effervescent Prosecco, a bittersweet and bright Italian aperitivo, and fresh orange. We include all three of those ingredients in this layered dessert. It‚Äôs like an adult version of an orange Creamsicle!Get the Aperol Spritz Trifles recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9Fruit TartPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREIf you‚Äôre one of the many who are stunned by the shiny fruit tarts in bakery windows, then this recipe is for you. Good news: It‚Äôs surprisingly easy to make a stunning fruit tart right at home! Make it as the star of your Easter dinner, or as an easy, warm-weather treat to indulge in anytime.Get the Fruit Tart recipe.10Strawberry-Rhubarb Crumble BarsPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GORELove that buttery sweet topping on a crisp or a cobbler? Then you‚Äôve got to try these strawberry-rhubarb crumble bars. Featuring tangy sweet fruit filling and a buttery crumb topping, these bars will make you the most popular person at your next spring cookout.Get the Strawberry-Rhubarb Crumble Bars recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Easter Chick CupcakesPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREEaster desserts are some of the cutest to make, and these little chick cupcakes are so fun! Make homemade vanilla cupcakes with our recipe, or save some time and use your favorite boxed cake mix. You can always make chocolate cupcakes or whatever your favorite flavor is instead too.Get the Easter Chick Cupcakes recipe.12Pistachio BrowniesPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThe fudgy, chewy treats are packed with melted dark chocolate and cocoa powder, then studded with chopped roasted pistachios and topped with homemade pistachio ganache. A combination of brown butter and almond extract amp up the nuttiness of the pistachio, making these the perfect snack.Get the Pistachio Brownies recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Copycat Cheesecake Factory Mango Key Lime CheesecakePHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONThis copycat has creamy mango and Key lime cheesecake, a layer of fluffy mango mousse, and a layer of mango glaze, all encased in a vanilla-coconut crust. Topped with TCF‚Äôs signature whipped cream tower, this dessert is great for when you want a fruity, sweet indulgence.Get the Copycat Cheesecake Factory Mango Key Lime Cheesecake recipe.14Petit FoursPHOTO: LUCY SCHAEFFER; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERHoping to make some homemade edible gifts that are sure to impress? Make petit fours. Featuring confetti cake layered with raspberry jam and buttercream and covered in a shiny white glaze, these stunning mini cakes will delight anyone who receives them.Get the Petit Fours recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15No-Bake Blackberry Cheesecake BarsPHOTO: JOEL GOLDBERG; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThis no-bake cheesecake gets a stunning, swirly topping of blackberries that looks more like art than dessert. You may not use all of the blackberry topping for the swirling, but save it. You can serve the cheesecake with the extra sauce to get more of that blackberry flavor. Get the No-Bake Blackberry Cheesecake Bars recipe.16No-Churn Strawberry Shortcake Vegan Ice CreamPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: LAURA REGEIce cream lovers, get ready to scoop, because this crave-able ice creamisn‚Äôt going to last! Plant-based, dairy-free, vegan‚Ä¶ no matter what you want to call it, this ice cream is as good as‚Äîif not better‚Äîthan any dairy counterpart, making it a favorite scoop of spring.Get the No-Churn Strawberry Shortcake Vegan Ice Cream recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Battenberg CakePHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDSERONWant to feel like you‚Äôre on The Great British Bake Off? Make Battenberg cake. White- and pink-tinted slices of rich almond cake are brushed with apricot jam, artfully stacked, and covered with sweet almond marzipan for a cake that‚Äôs stunning and delicious enough to win the approval of Paul Hollywood any day of the week.Get the Battenberg Cake recipe.18Carrot CakePHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThis tried-and-true recipe is tender and perfectly spiced with all the textures and flavors you‚Äôre looking for (no big chunks of carrot here üôÖ). Covered with plenty of tangy cream cheese frosting, this recipe is bound to be your new go-to for spring celebrations, Easter dinner, or any time you‚Äôre craving this beloved dessert.Get the Carrot Cake recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Strawberry Pop-Tart BlondiesPHOTO: NICO SCHINCO; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONButtery, chewy, and filled with strawberry jam, this dessert combines the nostalgia of Pop-Tarts and the classic comfort of blondies in one adorable bar cookie. The bite-size treats are great for breakfast or brunch, but also make a fun party dessert‚Äî plus they‚Äôre easy to pull together.Get the Strawberry Pop-Tart Blondies recipe. 20GelatoANDREW BUIThose who hail from Italy particularly love gelato, savoring flavors like nocciala (hazelnut), pistachio, and fregola (strawberry) by the cup as they walk through the piazzas of Rome, Florence, or Milano. If you‚Äôve never experienced authentic gelato, then you might just surprise yourself with how much you love it (maybe more than American ice cream‚Ä¶ shhh!).Get the Gelato recipe. Let's just say, your farmers' market basket will be overflowing once you check out all our top strawberry, lemon, and rhubarb desserts. Don't worry if you're Team Chocolate, we've got more than a few ideas for you too amongst these 50 easy spring dessert recipes too.Spring is the easiest and breeziest season of them all, so we wanted to make sure we had desserts that were just as simple to whip up. And with big holidays like Easter, Passover, and Memorial Day on the calendar, it's always good to have a few impressive (yet beginner-friendly) desserts in your back pocket for when you really want to dazzle your guests. Our Aperol spritz trifle, our raspberry tiramisu, and our strawberry upside-down cake are some of our top showstoppers and endlessly adaptable for whatever you have on hand too.As the temps rise, we start wanting to use our oven less and less. Is that also you? Well, what better time to cool down than with no-bake desserts or an ice cream cake. Honestly, hot weather or not, do you really need a reason make our recipes for no- churn strawberry shortcake vegan ice cream and copycat Dairy Queen ice cream cake? We thought so.Still got Spring Fever? Check out all of our favorite spring weeknight dinner recipes, spring cocktail ideas, and top spring salads.
